entry.title: Movie: Blackhat, starring Chris Hemsworth (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Blackhat, starring Chris Hemsworth (2015)20160211
It was refreshing to have good and respected Chinese characters as
the heroes of the story. Thor doesn't really pull off being a
hacker and his background is pretty lame. I found the movie very
boring overall and decided to drop it half-way through. There's a
lot of little interesting things throughout, but it doesn't have
enough action to stay hooked and the mystery isn't deep enough to
really want to know what happens. I think the problem is that the
villain just wants to make money and no one's life is really in
danger or anything, so I don't feel any suspense about what is
going to happen. I'd say that the movie is well made, but what they
made wasn't really a good plan to begin with.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Dragon Ball Z - Season 3 - Episode 64 - Fighting Power: One Million?
entry.content:
Dragon Ball Z - Season 3 - Episode 64 - Fighting Power: One Million?20160211

entry.title: Dragon Ball Z - Season 3 - Episode 65b - Piccolo the Super-Namek
entry.content:
Dragon Ball Z - Season 3 - Episode 65b - Piccolo the Super-Namek20160211
I had forgotten that Piccolo fused with Nail. It was cool that
Dende can heal people too. I'm constantly annoyed that the
characters don't do the obvious things though... in this case,
Dende should go run and heal Goku.
  • TV Shows

entry.content:
Sherlock - Season 4 - Episode 1 - The Abominable Bride20160205
It was very nice to have the show active again, but I feel that
this was a pretty bad episode. Ultimately nothing really happened
in the plot and the mystery of the villain in the past was very
cheap.

entry.title: Book: Ringworld, by Larry Niven (1970) (3)
entry.content:
Book: Ringworld, by Larry Niven (1970) (3)20160204
The ending of the book was a little bit disappointing as the story
wasn't really finalized in a meaningful way. I will definitely read
more in the series, though, so I suppose it worked.
  • Books
  • 1970

entry.title: Game: Tales of Zestiria (Steam, 2015) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Zestiria (Steam, 2015) (2)20160203
I played through this for a bit and did a bunch of story beats and
then explored and got to my first real dungeon. The battle system
was very fun and that's what it's all about. I did find a really
hard enemy on the field, that I feel like is just a tease for
later.

Total time: 4:26
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Zestiria
  • Steam
  • 2015

entry.title: Book: Ringworld, by Larry Niven (1970) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Ringworld, by Larry Niven (1970) (2)20160203
This is a fascinating book. The size of the thing is awesome. I
love the idea of the Mercator projection as a way to measure the
ring. The idea of their demise and how they couldn't recover
without resources is interesting as well.
  • Books
  • 1970

entry.title: Dragon Ball Z - Season 3 - Episode 62 - Piccolo's Return
entry.content:
Dragon Ball Z - Season 3 - Episode 62 - Piccolo's Return20160128
It's very annoying that they didn't make their wishes right
away. It's also annoying that they didn't bring back Chieze
(because Shenron already brought him back) or that they didn't
give Guru strength or that they didn't give Gohan/Krillin
strength. They're so foolish. The concept makes me wonder what my
three wishes would be...
  • TV Shows
  • Dragon Ball Z

entry.title: Book: Ringworld, by Larry Niven (1970)
entry.content:
Book: Ringworld, by Larry Niven (1970)20160128
I started reading this a few days ago. I like the far-future nature
of it and the way it has a kind of radical premise. I dislike the
counter-culture nature of it and that sort of thing, although I
suppose I should be impressed at how prescient that part of it is,
given that it was written in the 60s.
  • Books
  • 1970
